title: Account for incorrect `cfg` in fn argument types

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
[Given the following code](): <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
fn foo(a: #[cfg(feature = "x32")] u32 #[cfg(feature = "x64")] u64) {}
```

The current output is:

```
error: attributes cannot be applied to a function parameter's type
 --> src/lib.rs:1:11
  |
1 | fn foo(a: #[cfg(feature = "x32")] u32 #[cfg(feature = "x64")] u64) {}
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ attributes are not allowed here

error: expected one of `:`, `@`, or `|`, found `)`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:66
  |
1 | fn foo(a: #[cfg(feature = "x32")] u32 #[cfg(feature = "x64")] u64) {}
  |                                                                  ^ expected one of `:`, `@`, or `|`
  |
  = note: anonymous parameters are removed in the 2018 edition (see RFC 1685)
help: if this is a parameter name, give it a type
  |
1 | fn foo(a: #[cfg(feature = "x32")] u32 #[cfg(feature = "x64")] u64: TypeName) {}
  |                                                               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
help: if this is a type, explicitly ignore the parameter name
  |
1 | fn foo(a: #[cfg(feature = "x32")] u32 #[cfg(feature = "x64")] _: u64) {}
  |                                                               ^^^^^^

error: expected one of `!`, `(`, `)`, `+`, `,`, `::`, or `<`, found `#`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:39
  |
1 | fn foo(a: #[cfg(feature = "x32")] u32 #[cfg(feature = "x64")] u64) {}
  |                                      -^ expected one of 7 possible tokens
  |                                      |
  |                                      help: missing `,`

error: aborting due to 3 previous errors
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
error: attributes cannot be applied to a function parameter's type
 --> src/lib.rs:1:11
  |
1 | fn foo(a: #[cfg(feature = "x32")] u32 #[cfg(feature = "x64")] u64) {}
  |           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ attributes are not allowed here
  |           |
  |           attributes are not allowed here
  |
help: you can instead introduce a type alias
  |
  | #[cfg(feature = "x32")]
  | type Alias = u32;
  | #[cfg(feature = "x64")]
  | type Alias = u64;
  | fn foo(a: Alias) {}
  |
help: alternatively, you can use the `cfg` attribute on the argument
  |
1 | fn foo(#[cfg(feature = "x32")] a: u32, #[cfg(feature = "x64")] a: u64) {}
  |        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^   --  ^ ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ ^^--
```

_Case taken from https://kevinlynagh.com/rust-zig/_
